Documents/Programming/CategoriesObjC/NSMutableSet+CoreDataOrderGlue.h

00001 #import <Cocoa/Cocoa.h>
00002 
00003 
00004 @interface NSMutableSet (CoreDataOrderGlue)
00005 
00006 /* This category on NSMutableSet is used to convert the (unordered)
00007 mutable set obtained from -[NSManagedObject mutableSetValueForKey]
00008 into an (ordered) array, and vice versa.   The array is commonly
00009 required to display and edit data, at least in legacy applications
00010 getting a Core Data retrofit.
00011 
00012 Here is the problem.  Because Core Data is built on a
00013 relational database, its to-many relationships are (unordered) sets.
00014 Many applications require ordered relationships.  To add order, a
00015 'position' attribute is normally added to each child.  However,
00016 this model breaks down if children may have more than one parent,
00017 and thus different positions in each parent.  The solution is to
00018 interpose a Glue object between the child and parent.  
00019 The Glue object has a to-one relationship to a parent, 
00020 a to-one relationship to a child, and a single attribute, the
00021 position, which is the index of the given child in the given
00022 parent.
00023 
00024 This category provides two methods of "glue code", to convert
00025 from Core Data's mutable set, via the Glue object, to the
00026 (ordered) array representation which is commonly required,
00027 and vice versa. 
00028 
00029 API: The glueClass must be key-value compliant for orderKey
00030 and payloadKey.  The payloadKey accesses the child value.  */
00031 
00032 // The first method is used in the getter of an NSManagedObject,
00033 // to get the array.  (You can obtain the set, which is self, using
00034 // mutableSetValueForKey:)
00035 - (NSArray*)arrayWithOrderKey:(NSString*)orderKey
00036                                    payloadKey:(NSString*)payloadKey ;
00037 
00038         // The second method is used in the setter and is the Inverse
00039         // of the first method.  It replaces all objects in Mutable Set
00040         // with the new objects from Array
00041 - (void)setContentsToArray:value
00042                                  glueClass:(Class)glueClass
00043                                   orderKey:(NSString*)orderKey
00044                                 payloadKey:(NSString*)payloadKey ;
00045 
00046 @end
